content: I’m a 4th year undergraduate at UC Berkeley studying math and computer science. I do artificial intelligence research advised by Stuart Russell and Vikash Mansinghka. From 2020-2021, I worked full-time as a researcher at the MIT Probabilistic Computing Project. My research focuses on probabilistic programming and well-founded AI.
summary: I’m a 4th year undergraduate at UC Berkeley studying math and computer science. I do artificial intelligence research advised by Stuart Russell and Vikash Mansinghka. From 2020-2021, I worked full-time as a researcher at the MIT Probabilistic Computing Project.
title: George Matheos
SMCP3: SMC with Probabilistic Program Proposals
Brain computation as fast spiking neural Monte Carlo inference in probabilistic programs

summary: Inference in open-universe probabilistic models can be challenging.  We show how to automate a broad class of MCMC kernels for them, facilitating the development of domain-specific algorithms for inference about unknown objects & their relationships.
title: Transforming Worlds: Automated Involutive MCMC for Open Universe Probabilistic Programs
